intro: Tynanthus elegans, commonly known as the elegant tynanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume pods and often nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features small, delicate flowers that are typically pale blue or white, arranged in clusters. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets. Tynanthus elegans is often found in moist, open woodlands and thrives in partial shade to full sun conditions.
